content.description:
I’m giving the low start its own page, since it seems like its picking up in popularity.

The low start adds 3 or so hard moves to get you in to the start of

Toxic Shock

. Start on the obvious, bad underclings, find some smeary feet, and bust some unique moves that don't really get you anywhere except in to the sidepull start to

Toxic Shock

. This is a fun addition! I'll add the FA if someone knows who did it.
content.location:
Start with bad underclings just below

Toxic Shock

.

content.description:
Per

Chris Deuto

: "it starts on a good, independent sidepull right of

Mind Matters

crux. Make a hard cross, and go right. This is about V9. For the V10, start on bad underclings about a foot below the sidepull, and make a hard bump/cross to the sidepull, and finish the V9. This is a more logical start in my opinion and makes a V9 go to low end V10 by adding a crux move."
content.location:
This is right of

Mind Matters

.

content.description: This is a fun climb. Start low on a heavily chalked undercling/sidepull kind of in the bottom of a small pit. Climb up a dihedral through crimps and slopers to an engaging top.
content.location:
Hiking up to Mind Matters Boulder, this is on the panel directly in front of you. It is the furthest left line (may be something on the arete, but line is way less obvious if it is there at all) directly left of

Compression Matters

(both climb dihedral features).

content.description: Sit start with wide, opposing holds. Fight up bad holds to the lip and the good holds.
content.location: This is trailside on the Mind Matters Boulder. It is the first problem you will encounter.

content.description:
Nothing Really Matters is a fun but contrived problem that utilizes the cool, red step-like holds to the right of

Toxic Shock

. There are many ways to top this out from the start, but I thought this was the most fun and difficult.
content.location:
Start down and right of

Toxic Shock

on the arete. Use the arete for your right hand somewhat as an undercling and your right hand on a good, left-facing sidepull. From here, match, and move directly left into the red, blocky holds, and go straight up. For this problem, avoid any holds out right on the lip, and shoot for the giant horn jug above the red holds. Like I said, it is very contrived but fun.

content.description:
Despite being a little forced and unattractive, great rock and rad moves/sequences make this one worthwhile.

Begin sitting matched on a right facing sidepull, as for Mind Matters. Execute all the difficulties on Mind, but at the poor left hand undercling make a HUGE span out right to the start hold of Toxic Shock. Match and fight up Toxic to a victory finish.
content.protection: Several (6+) pads. Long climb with bad landing…
content.location: On the Mind Matters’ boulder’s main face, starting in Mind/Crimping and finishing way right on Toxic Shock.

content.description: Mind Matters is the namesake problem of the boulder and the proudest line for sure. Start in the center of the cave, and climb though underclings and sidepulls over.
content.protection: Pads, lots of them, and spotters.
content.location: It is in the center of the main cave on the Mind Matters Boulder.

content.description: The crux is down low, but the topout is exciting. The landing is not great. Use two pads at least.
content.location:
Start right of the ramp for

Compression Matters

, sitting on opposing sidepulls. Climb up and compress on some sloping rails, and exit right up the ramp.

content.description: Start low in a pit matched on a decent sidepull/undercling. Do a big move out left, and traverse left and up utilizing tiny crimps to hero jugs near the top.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. The landing isn't quite as bad as it might look on first inspection.
content.location: I believe it starts same as Mind Matters but breaks left instead of going up the center of the wall. From the hike in, circle left around boulder. You will see the start at the bottom of a pit.

climbs.name: Compression Matters Dyno aka Dynamic Matters

content.description:
Start as for

Compression Matters

, but then trend right though the face. Finish with a thrilling jump to the perfect mail slot over the lip.
content.location:
It is right of

Compression Matters

.

content.description: This has a strange start low on a slab triangle matched on chalked edge. Climb into a dihedral feature. You get big exciting moves at the top.
content.location: This is on the face in front of you if you are hiking in the traditional way. Of the two dihedral-like problems next to each other, this is the one to the right if facing the boulder. Note the strange, slab triangle start.
